pullRequest.body:
Add a simproc that checks whether `P a'` has the form `... ‚àß a' = a ‚àß ...` for the goal `‚àÉ a', P a'`. If so, it rewrites the latter as `P a`. 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->
I'm not sure where this file should be imported since it has no dependencies on Mathlib. Currently I import it in `Mathlib.Tactic.Basic`.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13524362868)

Here's a bigger Qq rewrite:
```lean
-- set_option linter.unusedVariables false in
/-- For an expression `p` of the form `fun (x : Œ±) ‚Ü¶ (body : Prop)`, checks whether
`body` implies `x = a` for some `a`, and constructs a proof of `(‚àÉ x, p x) = p a` using
`exists_of_imp_eq`. -/
partial def findImpEqProof {u} {Œ± : Q(Sort u)} (p : Q($Œ± ‚Üí Prop)) :
    MetaM <| Option ((a : Q($Œ±)) √ó Q((‚àÉ x, $p x) = $p $a)) := do
  lambdaTelescope p fun xs (body : Q(Prop)) => do
    let #[(x : Q($Œ±))] := xs | return none
    withLocalDeclQ .anonymous .default q($body) fun h => withNewMCtxDepth do
      let .some ‚ü®res, proof‚ü© ‚Üê go x h | return none
      let pf1 : Q(‚àÄ (b : ¬´$Œ±¬ª), ¬´$p¬ª b ‚Üí ¬´$res¬ª = b) ‚Üê mkLambdaFVars #[x, h] proof
      return .some ‚ü®res, q(exists_of_imp_eq _ $pf1)‚ü©
where
  /-- Traverses the expression `h`, branching at each `And`, to find a proof of `x = a`
  for some `a`. -/
  go (x : Q($Œ±)) {e : Q(Prop)} (h : Q($e)) : MetaM <| Option ((a : Q($Œ±)) √ó Q($a = $x)) := do
    match e, h with
    | ~q(@Eq.{u} $Œ≤ $a $b) => do
      let .defEq _ := ‚Üê isDefEqQ q($Œ±) q($Œ≤) | return none
      if let .defEq _ ‚Üê isDefEqQ q($x) q($a) then
        return .some ‚ü®b, q(($h).symm)‚ü©
      else if let .defEq _ ‚Üê isDefEqQ x (b : Q($Œ±)) then
        return .some ‚ü®a, q(($h))‚ü©
      else
        return .none
    | ~q(And $a $b) =>
      if let .some res ‚Üê go x q(And.left $h) then
        return res
      if let .some res ‚Üê go x q(And.right $h) then
        return res
      return none
    | _ => return none

end existsAndEq

/-- Checks whether `P a'` has the form `... ‚àß a' = a ‚àß ...` or `... ‚àß a = a' ‚àß ...` in
the goal `‚àÉ a', P a'`. If so, rewrites the goal as `P a`. -/
simproc existsAndEq (Exists (fun _ => And _ _)) := fun e => do
  let ‚ü®1, ~q(Prop), ~q(Exists $p)‚ü© ‚Üê inferTypeQ e | return .continue 
  let .some ‚ü®rhs, pf‚ü© ‚Üê existsAndEq.findImpEqProof p | return .continue
  return .visit {expr := q($p $rhs), proof? := pf}
```
using the moral "stay in Qq as long as possible"
This is very nice! Thank you, Eric. I always learn from you about Qq.
Can we also allow for the case where the equality is the other way round?
It actually does this! I added it to the docs.

```suggestion
  go {u : Level} {Œ± : Q(Sort u)} (x : Q($Œ±)) {e : Q(Prop)} (h : Q($e)): MetaM <| Option ((a : Q($Œ±)) √ó Q($x = $a)) := do
```
would save you needing a `mkAppM` to re-infer `a`
Here you can use `if let .defEq h ‚Üê isDefEqQ x a then` to make Qq behave, with my suggestion above.

perhaps clearer as
```suggestion
      if let .some res ‚Üê go x q(And.left $h) then
        return res
      if let .some res ‚Üê go x q(And.right $h) then
        return res
      return none
```

```suggestion
partial def findImpEqProof (p : Expr) : MetaM <| Option Expr := do
```

```suggestion
simproc exists_and_eq (‚àÉ _, _ ‚àß _) := fun e => do
```
since this is used like a theorem name.
Isn't this style conventional for simprocs? For example, we have `reduceCtorEq`, `reduceIte`, etc.
Should I rename it to `reduceExistsAndEq`?
Hmm, maybe a zulip discussion is warranted here.
This `simps` folder is for `@[simps]`, not for simprocs.
Where should I place it then, just create `ExistsAndEqSimp.lean` in the Tactic directory?
Perhaps `Tactic/Simprocs/`? Again, maybe a question for Zulip.

```suggestion
        return .some ‚ü®b, q(h.symm)‚ü©
```

Is it better than
```suggestion
    withLocalDeclQ (u := 0) .anonymous .default body fun h => withNewMCtxDepth do
```
?
At that point we already know that `body` has type `Prop`, because it is `Exists` argument, so we can skip `isDefEq` checking.

pullRequest.title: feat(Simproc): simproc for `‚àÉ a', ... ‚àß a' = a ‚àß ...`
